The script xtgeo_grid3d_map_apps¶

Make HC thickness maps directly from Eclipse runs using XTGeo Python library.

Features¶

  • From Eclipse files (EGRID, INIT, UNRST) make HCPV thickness maps
    • No need to invoke RMS
    • Efficient in FMU work flows
  • Outputs PNG figures and Irap binary maps
  • Configuration through a YAML file
  • Configuration from YAML can be overriden by command line options

Example of a YAML input file:

# In this example dz_only is applied (see thickness of the rock)

title: Gullfaks

# choose oil, gas or both
mode: gas

# zonation is the layer range and name of zone(s)
zonation:
  zranges:
    - Tarbert: [1, 6]

eclinput:
  root: "../xtgeo-testdata/3dgrids/gfb/GULLFAKS_R003B-0"
  dates:
    - 1985_10_01
    - 1985_10_03

# diffmode: none (no diffs are made), withfirst, all
computesettings:
  diffmode: withfirst
  # critical saturations
  # compute mobile SOIL using SOGRC or SOWCR or None (sogcr, sowcr, None)
  critmode: No
  method: dz_only
  # with DZ ONLY, hc_interval is almost required
  hc_interval: [0.1, 1]  # from 10% til 100% gas
  zone: Yes
  all: No

# map definition
mapsettings:
  xori: 451000.0
  xinc: 100.0
  yori: 6779000.0
  yinc: 100.0
  ncol: 120
  nrow: 130

plotsettings:
  valuerange: [0, 50] # value range min/max (values above below will be truncated in plot!)
  xlabelrotation: 10
  colortable: jet           # jet/rainbow/seismic/gnuplot/gnuplot2/...

  # individual settings will override general plot settings
  Tarbert:
    valuerange: [0, 20]

# output can be either mapfolder (preferred) or mapfile
# If mapfolder (and plotfolder), file names will be according to
# FMU standards which is lowercase uber alles, but here lowercase
# set to False as an example
output:
  mapfolder: TMP
  plotfolder: TMP
  lowercase: False

Credits¶

This package was created with Cookiecutter_ and the `audreyr/cookiecutter-pypackage`_ project template.
